item.title: From Aqua to Shalimar: A Vintage Las Vegas Strip Story
item.description:
A Humble Beginning: The Home Motel and a Fiery Start

The location at 1401 South Las Vegas Boulevard, now the Shalimar Hotel, boasts a layered history reflecting the evolving face of the Las Vegas Strip. Before the glitz and grandeur, it began as the Home Motel in the late 1930s â€“ a modest auto-court catering to travelers passing through. This was a time when Las Vegas was still carving out its identity as a destination. Sadly, the Home Motel’s early years were marked by tragedy: a significant fire in October 1941 devastated the property. But Las Vegas is built on resilience, and from the ashes rose something new.
